question: Complete the proverb: 'A penny saved is a _____.'
description: This proverb suggests that saving money is just as valuable as earning it.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Actions speak louder than _____.'
description: This proverb means that what people do is more important than what they say.

question: Complete the proverb: 'When in Rome, do as the _____.'
description: This proverb suggests that one should adapt to the customs of the places they visit.

question: Fill in the blank: 'The early bird catches the _____.'
description: This proverb indicates that those who start early or act quickly will gain advantages.

question: Complete the proverb: 'You can’t judge a book by its _____.'
description: This means you shouldn’t judge someone or something based solely on appearance.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Too many cooks spoil the _____.'
description: This proverb suggests that too many people involved in a task can ruin it.

question: Complete the proverb: 'Better late than _____.'
description: This proverb indicates that it is better to do something late than not do it at all.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Don't count your chickens before they _____.'
description: This means you should not assume success before it actually happens.

question: Complete the proverb: 'A bird in the hand is worth two in the _____.'
description: This suggests that it is better to have a sure thing than to risk it for more.

question: Fill in the blank: 'What goes around, comes _____.'
description: This proverb indicates that the consequences of one’s actions will eventually return to them.

question: Complete the proverb: 'If it ain't broke, don't _____ it.'
description: This means if something is working well, there is no need to change it.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Rome wasn't built in a _____.'
description: This suggests that great things take time to achieve.

question: Complete the proverb: 'You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make it _____.'
description: This means you can provide someone with an opportunity, but you can't force them to take it.

question: Fill in the blank: 'All that glitters is not _____.'
description: This means not everything that looks valuable is actually so.

question: Complete the proverb: 'A watched pot never _____.'
description: This means that time seems to move more slowly when you are waiting for something.

question: Fill in the blank: 'The squeaky wheel gets the _____.'
description: This means that the most noticeable problems are the ones that get addressed first.

question: Complete the proverb: 'An apple a day keeps the _____ away.'
description: This suggests that eating healthy can help maintain good health.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Two heads are better than _____.'
description: This means collaboration can lead to better outcomes than working alone.

question: Complete the proverb: 'Out of sight, out of _____.'
description: This means that when something is not visible, it is easily forgotten.

question: Fill in the blank: 'The pen is mightier than the _____.'
description: This suggests that written communication is more effective than violence.

question: Complete the proverb: 'Necessity is the mother of _____.'
description: This means that when the need for something becomes imperative, you are forced to find ways to achieve it.

question: Fill in the blank: 'A fool and his money are soon _____.'
description: This means that those who are foolish with their finances will quickly lose their money.

question: Complete the proverb: 'Beauty is in the eye of the _____.'
description: This means that perceptions of beauty are subjective and vary from person to person.

question: Fill in the blank: 'Barking dogs seldom _____.'
description: This means that those who make the most noise often pose the least threat.

question: Complete the proverb: 'Blood is thicker than _____.'
description: This means that family relationships are stronger than other relationships.
